creator: hzhr@21cn.com
text:
I am using Apache mod_proxy in Win32.
First, i found some sites(eg, web mail site: http://mail.sina.com.cn/ ), which 
use cookies to store the users' info, can't login in and/or communicate with 
client incorrectly(using IE, Mozilla, etc.).
And then, when I try to commit the bug here, things happen too. I filled the 
form ok and then click Commit, nothing happen but go back the user login form
(http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/post_bug.cgi).
I tested in Win32, maybe others have it too.
1.3.20 has no this problem. 
Maybe things come from mod_proxy HTTP/1.1 support. I bet the mod_proxy doesn't 
send the browse the right cookies or heads, in this site my browse never gets 
the cookies when i login. Sure.
Thanks! Sorry for my poor English,I hope you know me.

creator: minfrin@sharp.fm
text:
Please test the latest CVS version of mod_proxy, a number of problems have been
fixed. Otherwise v1.3.25 is due to be released in the next week or so, if the
problem remains in this version, please reopen this bug report.
